posts.title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
posts.description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Wednesday, December 12, 2012 at 12:00 noon in JWW 440.

posts.title: Pick up a Copy of the Brown Political Review!
posts.description:
Want to read what your fellow peers have to say about the current state of local, national, and international affairs?

If so, then pick up a copy of the Brown Political Review, a political magazine sponsored by the Political Theory Project. Copies of the magazine will be available this week in Faunce, J. Walter Wilson, and in the dining halls. Get your copy today!

posts.title: Staff Holiday Party TODAY in Sayles Hall, 12-2pm
posts.description: The Staff Holiday Party is TODAY December 12 in Sayles Hall.  All Brown staff are invited to attend this festive celebration in honor of their hard work all year. Food and entertainment will be provided. Stop by anytime between noon and 2 p.m. to enjoy this event with your colleagues. A great way to end the fall semester and begin the holiday season!

posts.title: Cookies, Hot Chocolate, Crafts: Study Break TODAY!
posts.description: Don't let finals get you down! Give yourself a break from studying and come join us for Meeting St. cookies, hot chocolate, and simple crafts. It's a perfect way to unwind and recharge. Drop in from 1-4PM TODAY (12/12/12) at Faunce Memorial Room 229. Brought to you by The Student Volunteers for the Samaritans of Rhode Island.

posts.title: Food Recovery Network: Snack Donation Frenzy!
posts.description: (FRN- part of HOPE) Send some holiday cheer to the women's and children's shelter and give back to the Providence community by donating snacks at Jo's! Thursday, December 13th from 8-9 PM, you can use up some extra meal credits, purchase something extra or buy something to use your whole credit. FRN volunteers will be standing by to answer any questions

posts.title: BOOKSTORE HOLIDAY SALE ENDS SUNDAY
posts.description:
The Brown Bookstore Holiday Sale continues through Sunday, December 16th, featuring discounts from 20% to 50% on a wide variety of merchandise!

Sale is in-store only. Some exclusions apply. Quantities are limited.

For more information call x3-3168.

Hours:
Mon�Fri 7:30�8 � Sat 10�8 � Sun 10�6
(Textbook Department & Technology Center close at 6pm daily)

posts.title: Write & Make Art for Watershed Journal this Winter
posts.description: Watershed Journal, Brown and RISD's publication of Environment and Culture, seeks submissions of Art, Photography, Poetry, and Prose. Have an idea for a piece? E-mail us at Watershed_Journal@brown.edu with thoughts and questions. We would love to work with you over winter break to create something wonderful.

posts.title: /~/~/~/~/~/~ LEAVETAKERS PIZZA STUDY BREAK 1 PM
posts.description: Calling past, present, potential leavetakers AND CATS to come to the Curricular Resource Center, Room 228 in Faunce, TODAY 12/12 at 1 PM - 2 PM for a PIZZA STUDY BREAK!

posts.title: JCB Fellows Lunch! (12/12)
posts.description:
The John Carter Brown Library will host a lunch chat at Brown RISD Hillel on December 12th at 12:00 p.m. Linda Sturtz, from Beloit College, will give a talk entitled, "Sett-Girls, Calemba, and Myal: Contextualizing African-Jamaican Women´s Musical Processions in the Pre-Emancipation Period". Linda is the National Endowment for the Humanities Fellow at the John Carter Brown Library.

Please bring your own lunch to Hillel. The talk will begin at 12:30 p.m

posts.title: Study Break With A4 TODAY (12/12)
posts.description:
Come out and take a break from work with the Pan Asian Council (PAC) and representatives of the Asian/Asian American Alumni Alliance (A4), as we video chat with Channa Srey (Outreach Officer). This is a great chance for you to learn more about A4 and opportunities for you to get involved with A4.

There will be plenty of HOT CHOCOLATE and MEETING STREET cookies for everyone. The event is open to ALL (especially Seniors)!

WHERE: Petteruti Lounge
WHEN: Dec 12 (Wed) 7 pm

posts.title: FREE, anonymous HIV testing THURSDAY, 12/13, 1-3
posts.description: Health Services is offering anonymous, drop-in HIV testing for Brown students tomorrow, Thursday, 12/13, from 1pm-3pm, at the LGBTQ Center on the 3rd floor of the Campus Center. No appointment needed. No blood draw needed. Drop by on your lunch break! Results available in 40 minutes or less. The CDC recommends that all sexually active people get tested for HIV at least once a year.

posts.title: Sign-ups NOW OPEN for SPRING MARKET SHARES
posts.description: The Brown Market Shares Program is now accepting sign-ups for our SPRING SHARE! BMSP provides weekly shares of LOCAL, SUSTAINABLE produce, dairy, bread, eggs, and meat to members of the Brown community. The spring share runs ten weeks from February 7th to April 18th (excluding spring break). For more information and to sign up for a share, please visit our website below. Spots are limited and sign-ups/payment must be received by FEBRUARY 1st. A limited number of subsidized shares are available.

posts.title: Summer Session 2013 Course Catalog Now Available
posts.description:
Summer 2013 Course Catalog is now available, listing over 50 courses
for browsing.

Anticipate small class sizes, dynamic discussions, friendly student support, and plenty of time with your instructor during Brown's Summer Session. Begin your planning for the early registration period in April.

posts.title: Cookies and Cider to Keep You Going
posts.description: The Office of the Chaplains and Religious Life knows that the end of the semester is challenging, so we'd like to give you a little treat. Come by J. Walter Wilson Room 411 on Wednesday, December 12 or Thursday, December 13 anytime after 4:00pm. We'll have hot cider and cookies waiting for you!

posts.title: Leave of Absence/December Completes
posts.description:
If you are taking a leave of absence during 2nd semester, you need to file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. This applies to educational as well as personal leaves. You also need to understand that you may lose your mailbox assignment while on leave and will be reassigned when you return to campus as an active student.
If you don't file a mail forwarding request all mail received while you are on leave will be returned to sender.
Thank you, Mail Services

posts.title: December Completes
posts.description:
If you have completed your degree requirements in December, you may use your mailbox during 2nd semester providing mail is picked up at least once a week.
If you will not be in Providence during 2nd semester, please file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. The length of time that we'll forward mail will be Dec 2012 to Aug 2014. If you have any questions, please wtire to Mail_Services@brown.edu

posts.title: Brown Men's Basketball hosts Providence College
posts.description: The men's basketball team hosts the Providence College Friars for the first time at the Pizzitola Sports Center on Friday, December 28 at 7 p.m. Plenty of good seats are still available in the general admission endzones. Tickets are $12 for adults and $5 for children 12 and under. To order your tickets, call the ticket office at 401-863-2773, stop by the ticket office, located at the Pizzitola Center, or online at BrownBears.com.

posts.title: Research Paper Help: Librarians After Dark Wed/Thu
posts.description:
Working on a research paper? Stuck or want to dig up some new resources for your project? Not sure how to create your bibliography?

Extra help with subject librarians is available in the Friedman Center between 7-9 pm tonight, Wednesday 12/12 and tomorrow night Thursday 12/13. Drop in to get one-on-one research help.

When: Wednesday December 12, 7-9 pm
Thursday December 13, 7-9 pm
Where: Friedman Center, Level A in SciLi

Librarians After Dark is sponsored by the University Library

posts.title: Update Your Voicemail Greeting for Winter Break
posts.description:
Now is a good time to update your voicemail greeting for the winter break. Please remember to include your name and department in your voicemail greeting.

To change your voicemail greeting:

Dial 3-9000
Enter Password
Dial 4, 3, 1, 2, 1
Record Greeting
Press #
Press # one more time to confirm.

Check out our voicemail manual on-line at https://wiki.brown.edu/confluence/display/CISDOC/Voicemail+Guide

or call Telecom at 3-2007.

posts.title: *TODAY* code4change: Tech, Entrepreneurship,Change
posts.description:
Interested in Technology, Entrepreneurship and Social Change?

Want to use your coding skills for social good?

Want to intern in a NGO in Kenya?

Come to Code4change info session:
1pm, Wed Dec 12
CIT, Lubrano Room 477

Code4change networks students with 4 Kenyan NGOs and gives students the opportunity to apply their technological skills for social change in Kenya. Code4change is sponsored by the Swearer Centre for Public Service.

RSVP http://bit.ly/WYBHhw
Email achew@cs.brown.edu

posts.title: DESIGN A BROWN T-SHIRT & WIN SOME $$$
posts.description:
Have a great idea for a Brown t-shirt design? Submit it to reach@brown.edu with the subject line "T-shirt submission". Please send high quality design images. If you win, your t-shirt will be produced and sold at the Campus Center Info Desk! You will also be compensated for your design if it is chosen!

So send in a design, and possibly make some $$$! Submit as soon as possible.

posts.title: TODAY: Center for Study of Slavery &Justice
posts.description:
Center for the Study of Slavery and Justice
Opening Reception
December 11, 2012
4:00-5:00 PM
Crystal Room
Alumnae Hall
194 Meeting Street
Open to the entire Brown community

Please join us for an opening reception to celebrate the Center for the Study of Slavery and Justice (CSSJ)'s inaugural year. Learn more about CSSJ and upcoming events in Spring 2013!

All are welcome!

To learn more about CSSJ please visit: http://brown.edu/slaveryandjustice/

posts.title: Study Break Tonight!
posts.description:
Maddock Alumni Center 7pm - Take a break from your studies to relax and refuel with free coffee, tea, fresh fruit and sweets at Maddock Alumni Center!
Tuesday, December 11 from 7pm - 8:30pm.
Bring a Friend!
Sponsored by the Brown Alumni Association

posts.title: Google Tip: A Minimalist Inbox
posts.description: Does your inbox look too cluttered? Follow the link below for settings you may want to change.

posts.title: Library Pizza Nights
posts.description:
Take a break for pizza and more in the Rockefeller Library, tonight, Tuesday, December 11th at 9pm or tomorrow evening in the Sciences Friedman Study Center, Wednesday, December 12th at 9 pm.

Sponsored by Campus Life and the University Library.

posts.title: Round Magazine Reading and Release 12/12/12
posts.description: Please join the Round Magazine for the reading and release of Issue VII on 12/12/12 at 6 p.m., the Brown Bookstore. There'll be copies of the magazine, food, and drink. We hope to see you there!

posts.title: The Critical Review seeks your feedback!
posts.description:
The Critical Review is in the process of evaluating our review system and website, and we'd love to hear from you. Regardless of whether you've found the CR to be helpful or not, please take the time to fill out our feedback form: http://goo.gl/M7teK. Your response is greatly appreciated!

Do feel free to contact us at Critical_Review@brown.edu with questions, comments, and suggestions.

posts.title: Recruiting Spring 2013 Brown Pen Pals
posts.description: Dear Student, fancy writing anonymously to someone and exchanging thoughts? Looking for something fun or philosophical? Does the idea of getting paired with a student pen pal at Brown appeal to you? Get paired, write to each other, and potentially meet! Email us at BrownPenPals@gmail.com if you'd like to be a pen pal next semester. Sincerely, Brown Pen Pal Co-Coordinators. PS: Alums are also welcome to be pen pals.

posts.title: ***DST/KAPsi SEX TRIVIA CHALLENGE!***
posts.description: Need a break from studying? Come out and join the Lambda Iota Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. and the Lambda Xi Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. at our SEX TRIVIA CHALLENGE led by Brown SHAG on Wednesday 12/12/12 at 7:00PM in Smitty B, Room 101! Come learn about how to be sexually SAFE throughout your time at Brown while playing an exciting trivia game! Prizes and safe sex giveaways will be distributed! Can't wait to see you there!

posts.title: Brown University Polo Club
posts.description: Ever ridden a horse? Ever thought about riding a horse? Brown Polo Club wants YOU to come out and give polo a try! For more information please email brownpoloclub@gmail.com and check out our Facebook page.

posts.title: Indy! Indy! Indy! Apply to be an Editor!
posts.description:
Interested in editing? Interested in local reporting, literary nonfiction, putting together a paper publication? The College Hill Independent—Rhode Island´s second largest weekly newspaper—is now accepting applications. We´re looking for section editors, illustrators, designers, and web gurus.

For more information or for applications email us at theindy@gmail.com

Deadline is this Sunday, December 16th, at 11:59 pm!

posts.title: TEXTBOOK RENTAL RETURNS ALERT
posts.description:
The Brown Bookstore would like to remind students that the Fall 2012 semester textbook rental returns deadline is Friday, December 21st.

Textbook rentals returned after this date are subject to a late penalty.

For questions please email: textbooks@brown.edu, or call the textbook department at 863-2270.

posts.title: Tur-Duck-In!  Executive Chef Demonstration
posts.description: Join the Faculty Club's Executive Chef, Dave Chabot, today, Tuesday, December 11 at 5:00 p.m. and discover the secret to preparing this seasonal holiday favorite dish! Chef Dave will provide recipes and interactive discussion as well as tasty samples. Warm Cran-Apple Mulled Cider will also be served. This class is only $9.95 per person inclusive. Please call 863-3023 to reserve your space for this special demonstration!

posts.title: &@&>> APPLY TO EDIT INDY SCIENCE <<&@&
posts.description: The College Hill Independent is seeking Science editors (and other editors!) for Spring 2013. Care about science, technology, medicine, or the environment? Want to help shape an alternative point of view on local and global issues? Edit Indy Science! E-mail indyscience@gmail.com with questions and to get an application. APPLICATIONS DUE Sunday, December 16 at 11:59pm.

posts.title: Summer Study Abroad General Info Session
posts.description: If you are interested in summer study abroad, plan to attend this Summer Study Abroad General Info Session in the Office of International Programs on Tuesday, December 11, 2012 at 4:00pm in J. Walter Wilson 440.

posts.title: Exciting New Medieval Course Spring 2013
posts.description: Come join an exciting new course in Comparative Literature/Medieval Studies! COLT 1813H: "God, Sex, and Grammar: Literary Ethics in Medieval Europe." Reading some of the great authors of the medieval world—including Chaucer, Dante, and Christine de Pizan—this course will explore what it means to read and write ethically, and how literary ethics relate to areas such as religion, sexuality, capitalism, and more. Tu Th 6:30-7:50. Open to undergrads and grads. Contact john_moreau@brown.edu

posts.title: TWC Giving Tree- FINAL WEEK
posts.description:
The Final Week for the TWC Giving Tree - Brown University´s Annual Holiday Gift Drive.

Give a gift to a child in need

Pick up an ornament from a Giving Tree at one of the
locations around campus (locations below).
2) Age and gender of the child is specified on the back.
3) Purchase a gift & wrap it.
4) Attach the ornament back on the gift.
5) Place the gift in any of the Giving Tree boxes on
campus.

posts.title: POST- MAGAZINE SEEKS SECTION EDITORS
posts.description:
Do you have a sparkling wit, a keen editorial eye, and a knack for lining up writers? If yes, Post- Magazine, the weekly arts and culture supplement to the Brown Daily Herald, wants YOU to apply to be a section editor for next semester. Our Features, Arts & Culture, and Lifestyle sections are all seeking editors. Email post.magazine@gmail.com for more information and an application!

Applications are due Friday, December 21.
